title: OSHA PEL vs Action Level: What’s the Difference?
summary: Learn the difference between OSHA permissible exposure limits and action levels and why both matter.

sections.heading: What Is a PEL?
body: The Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL) is the maximum allowable exposure to a hazardous substance over a defined time period.
Exceeding a PEL requires immediate corrective action.

sections.heading: What Is an Action Level?
body: An Action Level is a lower threshold that triggers additional monitoring or protective measures.
It serves as an early warning system.

sections.heading: Why Both Matter
body: Action Levels help prevent exposures from reaching the PEL.
Understanding both thresholds improves safety and compliance.
